answers.answer: I'm 40 with Type 1 since I was 1.  I love my Nintendo Wii Fit. I'm in the house in case I go low or I'm high and need to monitor.  I can stop and no one  stares at me.They have yoga and the basic sports packet that comes with the Ninteno system can get your heart pumping.  Since you have to stay in front of the TV there isn't a ton of leg work. Swimming or even kicking in a jacuzzi is good but a hassle but it also gets the pressure off the legs. Good luck,

question: I am a 56 year old female with Type I diabetes since the age of 12.  I am under excellent control for the past 5 years.  Before that, not good but not horrible.  My latest A1C was 5.9.  My cholesterol is also excellent; however, I have trouble with my legs.  They tire quickly and cramp up when pushed.  I had tests for PAD about 3 years ago but nothing significant was found.  Between menopause, thyroid problems and quitting smoking four years ago I have gained about 40 lbs.  I want to lose weight but can't seem to find the right combination of diet and exercise.  Since walking is not an option I don't know where to start.  Anyone have any ideas?
title: Type I and weight loss
